DataElement.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Form Data Collection Use Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text explanation of the use of a concomitant medication data collection form based on intended application to a particular portion of therapy or more widely.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Form Data Collection Context
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Concomitant; following as a consequence._A drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease._A printed or electronic document with spaces to be filled out._gathering or assemblage of information (statistics or measurements) about a system, population, etc.; do not confuse with SAMPLE COLLECTION (PHYSICAL)._The universe of discourse that surrounds a language unit and helps to determine its interpretation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.:A drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease.:A printed or electronic document with spaces to be filled out.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
A printed or electronic document with spaces to be filled out.

Property.preferredDefinition: gathering or assemblage of information (statistics or measurements) about a system, population, etc.; do not confuse with SAMPLE COLLECTION (PHYSICAL).:The universe of discourse that surrounds a language unit and helps to determine its interpretation.

Concepts.definition: gathering or assemblage of information (statistics or measurements) about a system, population, etc.; do not confuse with SAMPLE COLLECTION (PHYSICAL).
The universe of discourse that surrounds a language unit and helps to determine its interpretation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concomitant Medication per CDISC CM Definition

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol._A printed or electronic document with spaces to be filled out._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.: Increasing by successive addition.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Specified; clearly and explicitly stated.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.: An event or sequence of events that constitute round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Used to refer to every member of a group of people or things, considered individually.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.: The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: Used to refer to every member of a group of people or things, considered individually.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concomitant Medication per CDISC CM Definition

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol.:A printed or electronic document with spaces to be filled out.:A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol's complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol.
A printed or electronic document with spaces to be filled out.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
